summary: Under the Americans with Disabilities Act, companies that administer standardized higher education tests—like the SAT or GRE—must grant accommodations to individuals with disabilities. The most common accommodations granted in 2019-2020 were extra time and testing environment adjustments, like preferential seating or a separate room. But some individuals with disabilities had difficulty providing adequate documentation to justify their requests. And 5 of 6 testing companies we...
title: Higher Education: Testing Companies Most Commonly Granted Extra Time to Accommodate Individuals with Disabilities
